intro: Vittadinia spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically has basal leaves that are broad and spatulate in shape, giving it its common name. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in a disc-like cluster, which are surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. Vittadinia spathulata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands.
